com.flipkart.lois.channel.impl
Class BufferedPassByRefChannel<T>

java.lang.Object
  com.flipkart.lois.channel.impl.BufferedChannel<T>
      com.flipkart.lois.channel.impl.BufferedPassByRefChannel<T>
Type Parameters:
T -
All Implemented Interfaces:
Channel<T>, ReceiveChannel<T>, SendChannel<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
SimplePassByRefChannel
public class BufferedPassByRefChannel<T>
extends BufferedChannel<T>

A buffered channel that passes an object by reference. This should only be used with immutable messages that ensure that any mutable state isn't leaked. This is more efficient than BufferedChannel because it does not make deep copies of messages.

Method Detail

send

public void send(T message)
          throws ChannelClosedException,
                 InterruptedException
Description copied from interface: SendChannel
Send a message of Type T if the channel hasn't been closed and is available to send a message. If the channel is not free put the calling thread in a wait state until it becomes available to send a message. If the channel has been closed then a ChannelClosedException is thrown.

Specified by:
send in interface SendChannel<T>
Overrides:

send

public void send(T message,
                 long timeOut,
                 TimeUnit timeUnit)
          throws ChannelClosedException,
                 InterruptedException,
                 TimeoutException
Description copied from interface: SendChannel
Send a message of Type T if the channel hasn't been closed and is available to send a message. If the channel is not free put the calling thread in a wait state until it becomes available to send a message until timeOut TimeUnit's have passed, at which point throw a TimeoutException. If the channel has been closed then a ChannelClosedException is thrown.

Specified by:
send in interface SendChannel<T>
Overrides:
send in class BufferedChannel<T>
Throws:
ChannelClosedException
InterruptedException
TimeoutException

trySend

public boolean trySend(T message)
                throws ChannelClosedException
Description copied from interface: SendChannel
A non blocking send of Type T if the channel hasn't been closed and is available to send a message. If the channel is not free return false, if the channel is available and send was successful return true.

Specified by:
trySend in interface SendChannel<T>
Overrides:
trySend in class BufferedChannel<T>
Returns:
true if send was successful, false if send failed at this instance.
Throws:
ChannelClosedException
